data.title: Review of Gifts 2008â€“2009 - Fairfield University
data.text: table of Contents President’s Circle ............................ 47 Undergraduate alumni ................... 55 Graduate alumni ............................. 72 Parents ............................................. 75 friends and neighbors .................. 79 lyons-lademan athletic fund ...... 83 Corporations and foundations ..... 87 Matching Gifts ................................. 89 Gifts-in-Kind ..................................... 90 bellarmine society ......................... 91 Honorary and Memorial Gifts ....... 92 scholarships .................................... 95 fairfield awards dinner ................. 96 United for fairfield In recognition of and appreciation for the support extended from alumni, parents, and friends, Fairfield University has established the following Gift Societies: The President’s Circle Please Note: Great care and effort have been taken to ensure that this Honor Roll of Gifts is accurate, but errors or omissions may have occurred and we apologize. Please call the Office of Constituent Relations at (203) 254-4000, ext. 3473 if an inaccuracy is found. Remember that this Honor Roll only reflects those gifts received between July 1, 2008, and June 30, 2009. 44 Cornerstone Club $25,000+ Chairman’s Club 10,000+ Founder’s Club 5,000+ 1942 Society 2,500+ Member 1,000+ Loyola Companions $500+ X avier Associates 250+ Fairfield Fellows 125+ Donors 1-124 Review of Gifts 2008–2009 dear friends, As you all know, the effects of the economic downturn have spread far and wide over the past year. Every member of the Fairfield University community has been impacted in ways both large and small. However, in spite of the turmoil, Fairfield’s supporters have done what they do best — they have stepped up and have continued to demonstrate how much Fairfield means to them. This spirit of generosity is at the core of what a Jesuit education is all about. Many of our alumni, parents and friends found themselves financially stretched this year, yet over 5,500 people gave what they could in support of the Annual Fund, one of Fairfield’s most important initiatives. Donors supported many areas of the University, contributing nearly $9 million in total over the course of the fiscal year (July 1, 2008 – June 30, 2009), including $3.4 million to the University’s endowment. Many sacrifices were made on behalf of Fairfield this year, and on behalf of the entire community, I wish to express my appreciation to each and every person listed in the pages to follow. As you read this year’s Honor Roll of Giving, I hope you will be as inspired as I am by the outpouring of support shown to the University and that you will join me in contributing to an even brighter picture in the years to come. Sincerely, Jack L. Kelly ’67, P’96 University Trustee Chair, Advancement Committee
